<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 5+"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Potion of Disguise](/Equipment.aspx?ID=719)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=36" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Polymorph" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=127" />
<trait label="Potion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=130" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 258 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
<row gap="tiny"><row>**Activate**</row><actions string="Single Action" /><row>Interact</row></row>

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Upon imbibing this potion, you take on the appearance of a specific type of creature for 2d12 hours. The type of creature is determined when the potion is created. For example, you might have a _potion of elf disguise_ or _potion of frog disguise_. Drinking the potion doesn't impart the knowledge of how long the effect lasts; the GM rolls the duration in secret.

 The disguise doesn't change your traits or statistics, nor does it give you any of the special abilities of the creature you're imitating. It might affect what items you can hold or wear (for example, your new form might lack opposable thumbs). The potion shrinks you down to a minimum of size Small, or maintains your size if the creature is your size or larger. For example, if you are Medium and drink a _potion of fire giant disguise_, you'll take on the appearance of a [fire giant](/Monsters.aspx?ID=223) but remain Medium. The creature has to be of a specific kind, such as “[leopard](/Monsters.aspx?ID=67)” or “[lion](/Monsters.aspx?ID=68)” rather than just “cat,” or “fire giant” or “[ogre](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=78)” rather than just “giant,” but the potion can't cause you to mimic a specific individual creature.

 The effects of this potion use the same rules as the [Impersonate](/Actions.aspx?ID=46) activity of [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5). Onlookers always assume you're the chosen type of creature unless they're actively [Seeking](/Actions.aspx?ID=84). You gain a +4 status bonus to your Deception DC against such Perception checks and add your level even if untrained.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

<title
level="2"
right="Item 5"
pfs="Standard"
>
Potion of Disguise (Lesser)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 258 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Price** 30 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** L

</row>

</column>

**Craft Requirements** Initial raw materials must include a bit of blood, hair, or flesh of the creature the potion will allow the drinker to imitate.

<title
level="2"
right="Item 8"
pfs="Standard"
>
Potion of Disguise (Moderate)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 258 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Price** 100 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** L

</row>

</column>

---

The potion can increase your size if the creature is larger than you, to a maximum of Large, and it can shrink you to a creature of size Tiny. This doesn't change any of your statistics, with the exception of reducing your reach to 0 feet as a Tiny creature.

**Craft Requirements** Initial raw materials must include a bit of blood, hair, or flesh of the creature the potion will allow the drinker to imitate.

<title
level="2"
right="Item 11"
pfs="Standard"
>
Potion of Disguise (Greater)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 258 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Price** 300 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** L

</row>

</column>

---

While drinking a _greater potion of disguise_, if you picture the specific form you want to transform into, the potion will change you into that form. You can attempt to Impersonate a specific individual, though you still need to roll Deception.
